item.title: Sly and fabulous beasts
item.description: This program, "Sly and Fabulous Beasts," focuses on humorous animal fables.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor--History and criticism.

item.title: The dearth of news
item.description: In the first episode of this series, Smeall discusses humor's important place in American culture and the need for "a richer knowledge" of the history of humor in America. Early examples of American humor are examined.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: American newspapers.

item.title: The dearth of news
item.description: In the first episode of this series, Smeall discusses humor's important place in American culture and the need for "a richer knowledge" of the history of humor in America. Early examples of American humor are examined.

item.dc:subject: Periodicals

item.title: Learning and respectability
item.description: This program explores the integration of early humor and immigrants.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor.

item.title: Female agitations
item.description: This program, "Female Agitations," looks at women and humor.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Femininity--Humor.

item.title: The playhouse in a new reality
item.description: The Playhouse in a New Reality
item.dc:creator: Smeall, J. F. S.
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor--History and criticism.

item.title: Recapitulation
item.description: In this program, "Recapitulation," the dramatic effect that the late-19th century debuts of the vitascope and the wireless had on humor is explored.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Wireless communication systems--History

item.title: Constructions in a Hickok void
item.description: This program discusses the mix of humor and philosophy in American writings.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor.

item.title: Constructions in a Hickok void
item.description: Constructions in a Hickok Void

item.title: Steel mirrors for the old South
item.description: This program, "Steel Mirrors for the Old South," looks at Southern humor.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor--History and criticism.

item.title: The urbanite pastoral
item.description: This program, "The Urbanite Pastoral," looks at the pastoral fantasies concocted by frustrated urbanites.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Pastoral fiction

item.title: The grotesque corner
item.description: This program, "The Grotesque Corner," presents aspects of American humor that are inspired by the offbeat and the strange. Two stories by Edgar Allen Poe are central to the program.
item.dc:creator: Poe, Edgar Allan, 1809-1849
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor--Fiction.

item.title: The residing dignity of the law
item.description: This program, "The Residing Dignity of the Law," looks at the integration of American humor and American law.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor--History and criticism.

item.title: The late moral tails
item.description: This program, "The Late Moral Tails," features more humorous American fables.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor--History and criticism.

item.title: The playhouse in a new reality
item.description: This program talks about the influence that theater had on early American humor.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor.

item.title: A comic past
item.description: This program talks about the comedic beginnings for America.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor.

item.title: A traveller's quest
item.description: This program, "A Traveller's Quest," looks at Mark Twain's humorous writings on travel.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Twain, Mark, 1835-1910--Travel.

item.title: Change in the public letter box
item.description: This program traces the changes in style that can be found in letters sent to be printed in newspapers throughout American history. The emergence of humor in these letters is focused on.
item.dc:creator: Bryce, E. Scott
item.dc:subject: Open letters
